# Chief Intelligence Officer - Daily Brief
**Topic**: Latest global political and military news
**Time**: 2026/2/22 23:56

## Situation Overview
Welcome to the Daily News Channel, I'm Joe. Today is February 22, 2026. Welcome to the Daily News. In the past 24 hours, the global geopolitical landscape has experienced breathtaking upheavals. From the imminent military confrontation in the Middle East to the astonishing reversal of North American trade policy, and the brutal fourth anniversary of the conflict in Ukraine, the world is at a crossroads of multiple crises. In this episode, we will review 20 major events that have impacted global processes in the past 24 hours. We will take you directly to the dangerous standoff between the US and Iran in the Strait of Hormuz, focus on the Trump administration's massive arms sales to Taiwan, and delve into the security dilemma following the collapse of the US-Russia nuclear arms control treaty. In addition, the humanitarian crisis in Sudan, the diplomatic turmoil triggered by Greenland, and the US domestic tariff bill ruling will also be key focuses of today's coverage. Please see the details below.

## Key Intelligence
### 1. US-Iran military confrontation escalates sharply: Multiple clashes erupt in the Strait of Hormuz
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: 路透社、纽约时报、CBS News、维基百科
- **Summary**: According to our combined reports, tensions between the US and Iran have slid to the brink of war in the past 24 hours. US Air Force F-35 fighter jets shot down an Iranian Shahed 139 drone near the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier. Meanwhile, the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Navy attempted to intercept and seize a US oil tanker in the Strait of Hormuz, but failed due to strong escort from US warships. Reuters quoted President Trump as saying that the US is considering a limited military strike to force Iran back to nuclear negotiations. In response, Iran declared all EU member states' navies and air forces as terrorist organizations and partially closed the Strait of Hormuz, a move that has triggered severe turmoil in global energy markets.
- **References**:
  - [1] [路透社](https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2026/02/21/both-sides-are-sticking-to-their-guns-us-and-iran-slide-toward-conflict-as-military-buildup-eclipses-stalled-talks/209917)
  - [2] [纽约时报](https://www.nytimes.com/section/world/middleeast)

### 2. Trump chairs first peace committee meeting: pledges $7 billion to rebuild Gaza
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: 德克萨卡纳公报、纽约时报、CBS News
- **Summary**: According to The New York Times, US President Trump chaired the first "Peace Committee" meeting in Washington, aiming to establish a new diplomatic mechanism to bypass the United Nations. At the meeting, nine member states pledged $7 billion for reconstruction efforts in the Gaza Strip, and five other countries agreed to send peacekeeping troops to join the international stabilization force in Gaza. While Trump claimed this move would bring lasting peace, his warnings regarding Iran's denuclearization also escalated. CBS News also reported that the UN Security Council has passed a US-drafted Gaza peace resolution, authorizing the deployment of international troops to maintain security.
- **References**:
  - [1] [德克萨卡纳公报](https://www.texarkanagazette.com/news/2026/feb/21/trump-gets-pledges-for-gaza-reconstruction-and/)
  - [2] [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/tag/united-nations/)

### 3. US Supreme Court rules tariffs illegal: Trump announces global tariffs to rise to 15%
- **Time**: 2026-02-21
- **Source**: 纽约时报、TBS News、中信期货
- **Summary**: According to our report, the U.S. Supreme Court issued a historic ruling on Friday, finding the Trump administration's tariff collection methods illegal. To address the legal gap left by the court's ruling, Trump quickly announced a direct increase in the U.S. global tariff rate from 10% to 15%. The New York Times analysis points out that this move has led to significant uncertainty in global supply chains and triggered a temporary freeze on energy shipping routes. Currently, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has publicly stated that he will actively seek to establish trade links with non-U.S. markets to offset the risks posed by the North American trade agreement review.
- **References**:
  - [1] [纽约时报](https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/21/business/economy/tariffs-supreme-court-global-busines-reaction.html)
  - [2] [TBS News](https://www.tbsnews.net/worldbiz/asia/trump-says-indo-pacific-energy-meeting-be-held-tokyo-march-1367946)

### 4. The Russia-Ukraine war enters its fourth year: the road to peace remains bleak.
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: 美联社、CityNews、CBS News
- **Summary**: According to the Associated Press, as the fourth anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine approaches, the fighting on the front lines remains intense. In the past 24 hours, a Russian drone strike has tragically killed a Ukrainian father and his three children. Despite the Trump administration's efforts to promote a ceasefire, the positions of Russia and Ukraine remain deeply divergent. Putin has demanded that Ukraine withdraw from four disputed territories, while Zelensky has expressed skepticism about the US compromise. Furthermore, with Russian athletes being allowed to participate in the Paralympics, the Ukrainian government has announced a boycott of the 2026 Paralympics, extending the rift in the conflict into the sports arena.
- **References**:
  - [1] [美联社](https://www.newindianexpress.com/world/2026/Feb/22/after-four-years-of-war-by-russia-in-ukraine-peace-is-still-elusive-despite-us-push-for-settlement)
  - [2] [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/ukraine-crisis/)

### 5. The Trump administration plans to sell $10 billion worth of weapons to Taiwan.
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: CBS News、纽约时报
- **Summary**: According to CBS News, the Trump administration announced today plans to sell $10 billion worth of weapons to Taiwan, a record-breaking move. China immediately lodged a strong protest. Notably, the US and China are currently preparing for a summit in April, and this massive arms sale undoubtedly casts a dark shadow over the upcoming diplomatic meeting. Defense experts point out that arms trade has become one of the most challenging focal points in current US-China relations.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/tag/united-states-department-of-defense/)
  - [2] [纽约时报](https://www.nytimes.com/section/world/middleeast)

### 6. Greenland's sovereignty crisis escalates: Canada and France establish consulates to counter US annexation threat.
- **Time**: 2026-02-21
- **Source**: 德国之声、维基百科、爱尔兰独立报
- **Summary**: According to Deutsche Welle, in response to Trump's threat to annex Greenland, Canada and France have urgently opened consulates in Nuuk, the Greenlandic capital, to express their firm support for the Kingdom of Denmark. In response, Trump withdrew his invitation to the leaders of Canada and Ireland to participate in the Peace Commission. Meanwhile, the Danish government firmly rejected the hospital ship aid offered by the United States, stating that its medical system is self-sufficient. Currently, NATO has launched emergency consultations on security challenges in Greenland and the Arctic region, and regional tensions continue to escalate.
- **References**:
  - [1] [德国之声](https://www.dw.com/en/eu-migration-policy/t-65865159/page-14)
  - [2] [爱尔兰独立报](https://www.independent.ie/world-news/europe/trump-withdraws-peace-board-invite-to-canada-simon-harris-doubles-down-paying-a-billion-dollars-we-wont-be-doing-that/a211703287.html)

### 7. The US-Russia nuclear disarmament treaty has officially expired: the two sides have resumed high-level military communication.
- **Time**: 2026-02-21
- **Source**: BBC News、美联社、CBS News
- **Summary**: According to the BBC, the New START Treaty, the last remaining strategic nuclear arms reduction treaty between the US and Russia, officially expired on Saturday. At this critical juncture, the US and Russia agreed to re-establish high-level military communication channels that had been suspended since 2021 to prevent miscalculations. However, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the successful test of a new nuclear-capable missile at this time. The international community is widely concerned that with the disappearance of legal constraints, the world may be heading into a new round of nuclear arms race, particularly as international constraints on the nuclear programs of countries like North Korea will be further weakened.
- **References**:
  - [1] [BBC News](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/February_2026)
  - [2] [美联社](https://apnews.com/)

### 8. Yellow Sea Standoff: Chinese Fighter Jets Scrambled to Intercept US F-16
- **Time**: 2026-02-21
- **Source**: 南华早报、TBS News
- **Summary**: According to the South China Morning Post, US F-16 fighter jets stationed in South Korea recently approached China's air defense identification zone in the Yellow Sea, triggering a scramble of Chinese fighter jets for interception and standoff. This aerial confrontation occurred at a time of heightened sensitivity in the Indo-Pacific region. Despite this, the Trump administration announced an Indo-Pacific energy conference to be held in Tokyo in March and plans a visit to China in late March or early April. Diplomatic analysts point out that while military confrontations are frequent, high-level communication channels are still attempting to find breakthroughs in the energy and trade sectors.
- **References**:
  - [1] [南华早报](https://www.scmp.com/topics/south-korea)
  - [2] [TBS News](https://www.tbsnews.net/worldbiz/asia/trump-says-indo-pacific-energy-meeting-be-held-tokyo-march-1367946)

### 9. Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon kill Hezbollah commander
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: CGTN、纽约时报、维基百科
- **Summary**: According to CGTN, the Israeli military launched multiple airstrikes against targets inside Lebanon in the past 24 hours. In an operation near the Syrian border in Bekaa province, a drone strike killed four people, including members of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad. Additionally, Israeli attacks in eastern Lebanon killed a Hezbollah commander. It is estimated that the operations on Friday night resulted in at least 10 deaths. Analysts believe that this series of targeted killings risks the complete collapse of the existing fragile ceasefire agreement.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CGTN](https://www.cgtn.com/world/middle-east-and-africa.html)
  - [2] [纽约时报](https://www.nytimes.com/topic/middle-east)

### 10. US Vice President visits Armenia: Facilitates $9 billion nuclear energy export agreement
- **Time**: 2026-02-21
- **Source**: 美联社、Sada News、CBS News
- **Summary**: According to the Associated Press, U.S. Vice President JD Vance made a historic visit to Armenia, becoming the highest-ranking U.S. official to visit the country. During the visit, the two sides reached a $9 billion nuclear energy export agreement and signed the framework of Agreement 123, aimed at deepening bilateral civilian nuclear energy cooperation. Vance also discussed potential peace solutions to the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict with Armenian officials. This visit is seen as a key move by the United States to expand its influence in the region, particularly in the energy and security sectors, in an attempt to balance the influence of traditional powers.
- **References**:
  - [1] [美联社](https://apnews.com/)
  - [2] [Sada News](https://www.sadanews.ps/en/news/278223.html)

### 11. Sudan's civil war escalates horribly: Military hospital bombed, causing heavy casualties.
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: CBS News、德国之声、阿纳多卢通讯社
- **Summary**: According to a UN warning cited by CBS News, the situation in Sudan is experiencing a "horrific escalation." The Rapid Support Force (RSF) launched a fierce attack on El Fasher in Darfur, leaving tens of thousands of civilians trapped in shelters. More seriously, a military hospital in South Kordofan state was bombed, killing at least 22 people. The international community has again issued an urgent appeal for an immediate ceasefire to avoid a larger humanitarian catastrophe. Currently, Sudanese civilians are facing a severe food and medicine shortage, and civilian facilities such as shelters and schools have also been damaged by the fighting.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/tag/africa/)
  - [2] [阿纳多卢通讯社](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/February_2026)

### 12. Pakistan launches precision airstrikes against TTP targets in Afghanistan
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: News18、Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: According to News18, the Pakistani military conducted intelligence-based selective strikes against Taliban (TTP) hideouts in Afghanistan on Sunday. The operation resulted in the deaths of at least 28 militants. This airstrike comes just days after Kabul released three Pakistani soldiers, marking a sharp deterioration in relations between the two sides. The Afghan Taliban government strongly condemned the attack and publicly warned of a "necessary and deliberate" reciprocal response. Regional analysts fear the situation on the Pakistan-Afghanistan border could spiral further out of control.
- **References**:
  - [1] [News18](https://kannada.news18.com/commonfeeds/v1/kan/sitemap/google-news.xml)
  - [2] [Deccan Herald](https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml)

### 13. Demonstrations erupt at Iranian universities: Students protest against the current regime's rule.
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: 路透社、纽约时报、TBS News
- **Summary**: According to a Reuters report, large-scale anti-government demonstrations have erupted on campuses across Iran as the new semester begins. These protests coincide with the 40-day mourning period for those killed in last month's demonstrations. Despite a harsh crackdown by authorities, student groups have continued to assemble on campuses and chant slogans demanding reform. As a result of this unrest, European countries, including Germany, have condemned Iran, and numerous international flights to Tehran have been cancelled. Currently, internet access has been cut off in some parts of Iran, and the situation is highly tense.
- **References**:
  - [1] [路透社](https://www.tbsnews.net/worldbiz/middle-east/iranian-students-begin-new-university-term-protests-1367881)
  - [2] [纽约时报](https://www.nytimes.com/section/world/middleeast)

### 14. The Islamic State announced a new operation against government forces in Syria.
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: Deccan Herald、耶路撒冷邮报
- **Summary**: According to intelligence cited by The Jerusalem Post, the extremist group ISIS has announced a "new phase" of its operations in Syria. The group claims to have recently carried out two successful attacks against Syrian government forces in Mayadin and Raqqa, both in Deir ez-Zor province. Following the fall of the Assad regime, the current Syrian leadership faces a severe security vacuum. In response, the US military has increased its deployment and launched Operation Hawkeye to precisely target terrorist groups in Syria in retaliation for recent attacks on US personnel.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Deccan Herald](https://www.deccanherald.com/news_sitemap.xml)
  - [2] [耶路撒冷邮报](https://www.jpost.com/articlearchive/listarticlearchive.aspx)

### 15. Violent clashes erupt after Tanzania's national elections: hundreds dead
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: CBS News、德国之声
- **Summary**: According to CBS News, the unrest triggered by this week's election in Tanzania is escalating. The opposition claims that three days of protests have erupted nationwide in dissatisfaction with the election results, and the clashes have resulted in hundreds of deaths. International observers are deeply concerned and are calling on the Tanzanian government to exercise restraint. Meanwhile, several African countries are closely monitoring the situation, fearing that political instability in Tanzania could spread to neighboring regions. Currently, streets in major cities are blocked by military and police, and the situation shows no signs of improvement.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/tag/africa/)
  - [2] [德国之声](https://www.dw.com/en/eu-migration-policy/t-65865159/page-14)

### 16. A new level of defense cooperation between France and India: joint production of Rafale fighter jets
- **Time**: 2026-02-21
- **Source**: 《组织者》周刊
- **Summary**: According to The Organizer, French President Emmanuel Macron recently stated that the joint production of Rafale fighter jets with India has made significant progress. This project not only deepens the strategic partnership between New Delhi and Paris but also creates numerous high-tech jobs in India. The two countries pledged to further expand joint development in the defense sector, including cooperation on advanced aviation technology and maritime security. This cooperation is seen as a significant milestone in India's efforts to enhance its defense autonomy and also strengthens France's defense cooperation network in the Indo-Pacific region.
- **References**:
  - [1] [《组织者》周刊](https://organiser.org/)

### 17. US military completes airlift test of small nuclear reactor: Promoting rapid energy deployment
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: 美联社
- **Summary**: According to the Associated Press, the U.S. military recently successfully conducted an unprecedented airlift of a small nuclear reactor. This is a significant achievement of the Trump administration's policy of rapidly deploying nuclear energy. The military stated that this mission demonstrates the U.S. military's ability to rapidly establish independent energy supply systems in remote areas or pre-war environments. This technology combines state-of-the-art military logistics with modular nuclear energy applications, designed to ensure the U.S. military's sustained operational capability in any harsh environment globally. The project will be further expanded for testing to support future overseas military operations.
- **References**:
  - [1] [美联社](https://apnews.com/)

### 18. Nigerian military thwarts terrorist attack plot and rescues several children
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: Champion News
- **Summary**: According to our station, Nigeria's OPHK Operations Force successfully thwarted a terrorist attack plot in a recent raid. During the firefight, several armed insurgents were killed, and several kidnapped children were successfully rescued. The Nigerian government is currently reviewing its 2026 defense budget, planning a significant increase in intelligence and security spending. Furthermore, the military plans to strengthen cooperation with civilian sectors in the area of food security, utilizing militarized management methods to address domestic agricultural security challenges.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Champion News](https://championnews.com.ng/2026/02/22/troops-of-ophk-thwart-terrorist-attack-neutralize-insurgents-rescue-abducted-children/)

### 19. Pan-African debate focuses on political security: strengthening internal cooperation to counter external interference.
- **Time**: 2026-02-21
- **Source**: Afrique Media
- **Summary**: According to Afrique Media, in a recent Pan-African debate, several political analysts focused on the current security trajectory facing Africa. Experts emphasized that the African Union should play a central role and enhance governance transparency in the face of increasingly severe regional instability. The meeting called for strengthening political will and military cooperation within African countries to effectively counter external interference. Especially against the backdrop of frequent security warnings in West and East Africa, the construction of an independent defense system for Africa is now imperative.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Afrique Media](https://www.facebook.com/AfriqueMedia/videos/panafrican-debate-of-21-02-2026/1303539374938954/)

### 20. The United Nations faces pressure to lay off staff: Trump cuts billions of dollars in humanitarian aid.
- **Time**: 2026-02-22
- **Source**: 日本时报、CBS News
- **Summary**: According to The Japan Times, the United Nations is facing a severe financial crisis and pressure to lay off staff due to the Trump administration's announcement of billions of dollars in cuts to UN humanitarian aid pledges. Trump has demanded massive reductions and radical reforms of UN agencies. In response, Japan's representative to the UN stated that financial difficulties present an excellent opportunity to streamline the organization, and Japan is willing to play a leading role in building an efficient UN. Meanwhile, US Ambassador to the UN Michael Walz's defense of the US military's operation to arrest Maduro in Venezuela at the Security Council has further fueled widespread debate about the UN's authority.
- **References**:
  - [1] [日本时报](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2026/02/22/japan/un-financial-difficulties-reform-chance/)
  - [2] [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/tag/united-nations/)
